6$Condition: Depression$5/13/2019 11:21:16 PM$Reviewer: thankful, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been taking 300mg of Bupropion XL (the generic form of Wellbutrin XL) for four years and I have to say this medicine has saved my life. Before I started Bupropion
column2: I had had five depressive episodes in four years; I have not had a depressive episode since I began taking Bupropion four years ago. I can feel happy again and I can laugh. I am able to feel sadness
column3: but it doesn't overwhelm me. I am not drowning in self-loathing anymore. I am myself again and I have been myself for four years. As far as negative side-effects are concerned
column4: I will have a migraine if I accidentally skipped a dose the day before. It also took a while to kick in. The first two weeks were difficult because my brain would go ""offline"" in the afternoon and I wouldn't be able to do anything until my brain ""restarted"" later in the evening. This pattern lasted for a few weeks. The first month was pretty terrible
column5: though there were glimmers that things were changing; I would feel less awful than usual for ten minutes every few days. The second month was a little better; I was able to feel happy for an entire hour one day and could generally enjoy things more. Week nine was when I had five whole good days where I could feel happy any time I wanted all day long. Week ten was when everything took off and I started feeling like myself again. Four years later
column6: this medication still works for me. I have been able to get back on my feet and rebuild my life after my depression because the chemicals in my brain are working for me and not against me. I feel good. I can feel good whenever I want. I'm not held captive by depression anymore. Bupropion made all of that possible."

column2: 35-44 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$4$I had been on Wellbutrin 150 XL for 3 months as my dopamine all but completely shut off suddenly.I suddenly lost all motivation to do anything and could no longer enjoy any of the things that previously brought me joy.After reading online I believed it was having dopamine and not a serotonin-related issue so I asked my dr to try me on Wellbutrin 150xl's. It took a few weeks but turned the dopamine taps back on near full stream again. Side effects I noticed during this time were weightloss
column3: vivid dreams
column4: poor short-term memory
column5: anxiety(never anxious before)
column6: sudden and vivid recollection of very old memories
column7: intensified fight or flight response and longer to get back down to the baseline as well as oddly stronger smelling urine. I found greatly restricting caffeine mitigated some of the jitteriness. Even with some of these odd side effects
column8: I found it to be completely worth it for me to find enjoyment in my life again. It is also much much easier to cycle off than SSRI's and can be used for cycles when needed. I found it took about 5 weeks for me to feel full effects.

column1: 25$Condition: Stop Smoking$1/5/2018 8:48:32 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$4$4$ive taken this medicine before and quit after taking it for 3 days. This time though it made me a bit shaky

I dont really have cravings for a cig after the first few weeks. I did notice it does keep me awake at night more than normal. But nothing that is bothersome. so i would recommend this medicine over chantix anytime. Chantix was bad for me. i would sleep walk and literally cook in the middle of the night and not realize it. i would have such horrific nightmares and so much more. i refuse to take that again. so the  only other medicine i can take is this one. and for me it has worked. i set my quit date for jan 1
column3: 2018 and i smoked all the way until 11:30pm the night before. i have been quit ever since without too many issues. but its worth it.

39$Condition: Depression$4/2/2017 3:22:13 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months$3$2$3$I'm currently taking 450mg. Each increase in dosage was beneficial for about a week, but then I'd hit a plateau. 450 seemed to be the right dose for about 3 weeks, but I've been on this dose for 8 weeks now and feel like the cons are starting to outweigh the pros. I'm not as focused anymore, in fact I've began to have more apathy. My depression hasn't really been helped and I have emotional panic attacks now and then, especially if I drink alcohol-which I was told was the equivalent to completely skipping a dose..makes sense. I've lost 5 lbs, and I'm not binge eating when I feel low, but now I'm obsessed with the weight loss and feel like that's equally problematic. I am less impulsive, but now I seem more obsessive than normal. I've had multiple surgeries in the past 2 years and I was developing a narcotic addiction, within 2 days of taking this medication that craving went completely away, but my ruminating thoughts are increasing again and the impulse to take a pill for no reason but to feel numb is coming back. I take this along with Lamictal, I've been on Lamictal for 3 years, but it wasn't helping with my depression that I cycle with every 6 weeks. I'm ready to get off of this medication, especially since I notice an increase of negative behavior during my menstrual cycle and I'm a week away from another one.

86$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$3/28/2015 7:07:36 PM$Reviewer: b, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$Wellbutrin XL worked so well for my severe depression. This medication saved my life and helped me get graduate college. I started feeling better within a week without even trying on 150mg but increased the dose with my doctor to 300mg, which worked the best for me personally. For example, it allowed I was able to stop thinking negatively, could concentrate again, stopped crying all the time, and stabilized my mood at a functional baseline so I could get what I needed out of therapy. All my friends and family told me I was acting more like myself and had my zest for life back. I'm so grateful- before taking it, I did not have enough energy to walk a mile. I had lethargic depression and after taking this medication, I stopped sleeping 14hrs/day, was able to run 3miles like I used to, stopped binge eating, and lost 10lbs after about 5 months on the medication. Once I started getting better (I do not take this medication anymore as my depression resolved after a 9-month combination of Wellbutrin and psychotherapy), I started feeling restless and got agitated, which are side effects and decided with my doctor that I was stable and had enough support in place to stop taking Wellbutrin. I slowly decreased my dose over a month when I did not have a lot of stressful events in my life and consider myself a success story as I rarely have symptoms anymore of MDD. This medication was wonderful and I'm so thankful that it was available when I needed it during the darkest point of my life.

column5: and found a reliable pharmacy to order from for a fraction of the local pharmacy cost.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I am a 47 year old male diagnosed with ADHD combined with bouts of major depression. Over the years I have tried every tricyclic
column3: SSRI
column4: SNRI and atypical antidepressant on the market. While I was taking Ritalin or Dexedrine I never experienced the dpression but I decided that I wanted to go medication-free for my ADHD. I question the wisdom of that decision but anyhow my doctor suggested we try Wellbutrin and I agreed. I started by taking 150mg first thing in the morning and then 300mg every morning since then. It's been about 5 months now and I can't believe the change in how I feel! Wellbutrin lifted me out of the depression right away (ie within 2 days) and it helps with the ADHD symptoms as well. Not to the same extent as the stimulants but it's enough that I can focus now and get tasks completed. I am so thankful for whoever invented bupropion. One think I noticed is that it is closely related to amphetamine and diethylpropion
column5: both used in the past as anti-depressants/anorectics. I believe it is this similarity that gives Wellbutrin the edge over the SSRI's (which are garbage in my opinion)currently in use and I would not hesitate to recommend Wellbutrin
column6: Wellbutrin SR or XL to anyone who is suffering the debilitating symptoms of depression! Two thumbs up for Wellbutrin!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$1$5$"As an antidepressant

column6: I was not aware that I had a low seizure threshold and by the second week
column7: I had a 15 minute duration grand mal seizure and resulting head trauma.  Therefore

column1: For individuals NOT prone to seizures
column2: I think this drug could be very useful
column3: but I do think extreme caution should be taken when prescribing to anyone
column4: even is there is no known history of seizure
column5: and it is imperative that front office staff be educated on signs of impending seizure.

column1: I called the doctor's office to report very uncomfortable side effects that seemed to come on rather quickly (tremor
column2: severe ringing in the ears started overnight during second week of therapy and increased dose) and was told by the receptionist that they couldn't see me that day and ""might be able to work me in the next day""
column3: and to not stop the medication until I spoke to the doctor.  After I hung up the phone
column4: I immediately had my seizure.  I don't know if the agitation of their lack of care brought it on
column5: or if it would have happened at that moment anyway
column6: but I learned to be more insistent with medical staff members after this experience.

column2: overall
column3: a wonderful alternative to SSRI and SNRI meds
column4: but not enough education is provided to the staff at many medical offices and a 'warning sign checklist' needs to be in the patient file whenever this medication is prescribed."

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$"I was in a car accident & suffered damage in my neck that resulted in neurological damage(complicated migraine in my body). Went to ""top doctors""
column3: acupuncture
column4: chiropractic
column5: etc. the main point is I was told the AMA knows antidepressants have been found to work on specific migraine challenges. For 2 years I tried to get rid of the pain without medication until one day my migraine/stroke symptoms resulted in me thinking I was saying one thing and other words were coming out of my mouth! This terrified me! So I went to a top psychiatrist to see what antidepressant I should take. I had to accept the fact that I could not naturally get rid of my pain! This was in 1995.

column1: After much discussion it was decided that Wellbutrin would be the best medication with the least long term and short term side effects. I took the sample home and decided to work from home for a few days so I could take the medication safely.
I will never forget this experience
column2: it saved my life! Sitting at my dining room table
column3: 45 minutes after taking the pill
column4: doing paperwork when all of a sudden I felt a tingling sensation in the shape and size of a baseball at the exact location of my neck injury! I knew then that this medication would work. ( please understand that I was told not to expect any improvement for about 2 weeks!) we had to up the med once within in 2 months and that was it! Thru the years I have gone to the next generations
column5: using the latest now. I cannot use the generic
column6: it does not work the same and there are side effects! Most doctors know this but still people are forced to buy the generic due to cost factors. This is one medication no generic should be approved!

column2: I am fine. Thank Heavens! Hope this helps someone. "

185$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$1/24/2014 6:08:43 PM$Reviewer: TDT, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $1$1$5$suffered severe anxiety, lost weight, had tremors and had trouble walking in a straight line.
186$Condition: Depression$1/23/2014 2:52:31 PM$Reviewer: happycamper, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$I have been taking the generic form of Welbutrin (300 mg/day)for the past 3 years for chronic, low-level depression.  It has really helped me be more positive, less anxious, and more focused at work. On rare occasion, when under unusual stress, I take 10 mg of Xanax (in addition to Welbutrin) to help combat my anxiety.  I took Prozac for two years prior to starting on Welbutrin, but it just made me feel emotionally numb and finally stopped working altogether. I have had no adverse side-effects from Welbutrin and have lost the extra weight I gained while on Prozac.  It has not increased my sex-drive (unlike some other reviewers); however, it hasn't diminished it either.  I would highly recommend this drug to anyone suffering from low-level depression; although, I know everyone reacts differently.  My 18-yr-old daughter, who has ADD (inattentive type), was recently diagnosed with depression as well.  She just started taking Wellbutrin this past week (75 mg/day initially, increasing to 150 mg/day next week).  Hopefully, it will help her as much as it has helped me. (She also takes Concerta and Focalin for her ADD).
187$Condition: Depression$1/21/2014 7:04:57 PM$Reviewer: nomad, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$suicidal and uselessness thoughts disappeard within 2 weeks, can actually accept criticism with humor
188$Condition: Depression$1/20/2014 5:47:27 AM$Reviewer: Frank, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I had tried two other drugs in the past 10 years (SSRI).  I was almost ready to give up but then gave Wellbutrin a try.  The adjustment period was hardly noticeable.  I did have a few nights of restlessness and some night sweats in the first two weeks.  The only major side effect was a major increase in sex drive.  I already had a  high sex drive but this was ridiculous!  Just having thoughts of making love to my spouse brought me to the point of orgasm, while at work!  For a few days, I was going nuts with sexual desire.  Eventually, this side effect ended by the start of week three.  Now, after two months, I'm feeling much more calm and in control of my emotions.  Thoughts of suicide continued in the first few weeks.  Now, after a couple of months, those feelings are gone too.  I also no longer have any desire to smoke and other habitual desires are also gone.  My stuttering, and fast speech and anxiety are also more in control.  Overall, this is my miracle drug.  Can't say it will be the same for you, but for me, life is now grand and improving.

column1:
191$Condition: Depression$1/16/2014 12:08:01 PM$Reviewer: Katherine, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$4$4$I initially started Wellbutrin at 300 mg/day (150 mg twice per day) in 2005 along with Celexa at 20 mg due to depression and anxiety. I eventually stopped taking Wellbutrin when my Celexa dose was increased to 60 mg which appeared to be the right dose/medication for me. I was recently reduced to 40 mg of Celexa due to new studies that no more than 40 mg should be taken due to risk of heart issues/death. I am now back on Wellbutrin at 300 mg/day due to the decreased dosage of Celexa. Wellbutrin has worked for me. Side effects included decreased appetite, a little weight loss initially and dry mouth. I am a smoker and I thought Wellbutrin might help with that too, however, I did not notice any decrease in cigarette cravings while on Wellbutrin. The only thing I STRONGLY caution is do not EVER take more than your prescribed amount of Wellbutrin. I overdosed by accident (took 600 mg in one day) about 2 years after I started taking it, it was the worst experience of my life. Hallucinations, paranoia, insomnia....I literally thought I was dead and everyone around me was a ghost. I ended up going to the ER because of it (I actually thought my dead body was at the hospital and I wanted to go there to wake myself up). NEVER, EVER overdose on this medication. You will be sorry! But again, taken as prescribed, I am pleased with it. 
192$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$1/14/2014 10:12:15 AM$Reviewer: Scared mom, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Caregiver) $5$1$5$My daughter was on this medication for about 5 years and loved it. Only to end up in the emergency room with a seizure. PLEASE be aware of this Major issue!  It's real!!
193$Condition: Depression$1/11/2014 10:49:51 AM$Reviewer: RxLisa, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$5$I have been taking Wellbutrin XL 300 mg for about 5 weeks now (started on 150 mg).  This has been much more effective than any other antidepressant I've taken.  In the past 20 years I've been on Prozac, Celexa, Zoloft (with and without Abilify) and also Deplin.  The first couple of weeks, I was a bit more irritable, but was ok with it, because I cared about things again and was engaging again in life.  I was mostly irritated at how I had let everything go because I just didn't care or have the energy to do anything.  In the last couple of weeks, I have developed neck pain, headaches, and intermittently blurry vision, which all are listed possible side effects.  It's working so well for my depression at this point that I'm willing to wait a couple of months to see if the side effects go away.  I'm not sure if I've lost weight, but I'm cooking more often and eating less.  With all the other meds I've tried, it was the other way around.  All medications have side effects, these, for me are tolerable to be able to enjoy my young children and actually enjoy life again.  Before Wellbutrin, I was just kind of dragging myself through life.  I've had depression pretty much my entire adult life and tried it with and without antidepressants.  So far, With Wellbutrin XL, I feel like myself again for the first time in a very long time.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver) $1$1$1$My daughter suffered a rare severe systemic allergic reaction (DRESS syndrome) after two weeks of being on this drug.  The reaction is often misdiagnosed as a virus
column3: as was in my daughter's case.  After two clinic visits and two trips to the ER
column4: she finally was diagnosed correctly
column5: but had to be hospitalized for a week.   She gained 30 lbs. of fluid in just a few days and was covered with a beet-red rash.  Her major organs were also affected.  She had to be treated with steroids
column6: which is another side-effect story.  Be your own advocate-  if you develop a rash while taking any prescription drug
column7: take it seriously!   Your life depends on it.  DRESS Syndrome is a living nightmare and too many doctors do not have the expertise to recognize it.

She wanted me to go from 150mg to 300mg after 1 wk, but thank God I decided to stay on low dose. column3: but then couldn't afford the brand and started the generic. Awful; dry mouth
column4: anger
column5: sleeplessness

column7: and stomach aches; I feared long term effects and so I quit taking Celexa and bupropion over two weeks. It was truly horrible; crawly skin
column8: agitation
column9: depression
column10: anger
column11: disorientation and nausea. I lived in a bathtub for two days to calm my skin symptoms and calm my nerves. Six years later I still experience these same symptoms
column12: although not as pronounced. I don't feel my brain/body is the same and I'm staying away from drugs now. Healthy diet
column13: exercise and cognitive therapy as opposed to ""take the pill"". Being open with my friends and confessing feelings often helps. I still wake regularly agitated and upset/angry over something that is nothing later on when I'm rested and awake--so agitated I could be awake all night. I wouldn't do it again; I'd take care of health by going to a spa and getting verbal/understanding/relational therapy. Finding a decent counsellor is difficult
column14: but persist. A mentor
column16: a mature relative--these people can give a 'reality picture' or feedback so you can get grounded over time. It's not just understanding yourself; it's finding a real relationship that can go deeper than becoming a good social character. Someone to confide your soul with...don't stop looking but use your discrimination and don't just confide in anyone. Really know and watch the actions of this person for character and their own self-understanding. If you are really looking sincerely
column17: someone will appear and not necessarily cost you $100. an hour. For me
column18: it was a woman in my church. Good luck to you...

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $1$1$4$"Started out on the generic 150mg for 1 month and after no change in my depression

I could not use any of my motor skills and it felt like something heavy was holding me down. My doctor reported my symptoms to a neurologist who suggested that I may have been having seizures. Now I'm getting ready for an appointment to see the neurologist for an official diagnosis. I'm not sure if the name brand itself would have brought on the same results but I've been hearing too many negative feedback about the generic versions. Also not very pleased with my insurance for insisting that I take generic. The told me that if I want the name brand my copay would be about $300 for a 30 day supply (generic is only $15 for a 30 day supply). My doctor switched me to another newer brand which I am slowly adjusting to. So far the new meds allow me to sleep so I'm catching up on all that I missed while I was no the generic Welbutrin XL 300mg. I also gained 10 pounds while I was taking it so now I having to double up my workouts to lose it."

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$1$"I was recently diagnosed ""BipolarII-Manic Depressive"". I experienced some traumatic life events recently and planned suicide. Sought help and wound up hospitalized. I was put on Resperidone which i later found was an anti-psychotic med. I was extremely depressed but clearly not pyschotic. Post hospital psych doctor prescribed Wellbutrin 150mg 2x daily with Lamictal which is an anti-seizure med. Initially felt more cheerful and hopeful. After not sleeping more than 3-4 hours per night for 9 consecutive nights I missed two days of work from pure exhaustion yet still can't sleep. Also feel like someone is squeezing my heart and I am having night sweats. I will not take this drug ever again. Stopped today. Can't wait to get this out of my body. Don't know what my options are at this point. I don't see my dr for 4 weeks."

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"I have SAD(Seasonal Affective Disorder)and I have taken both the 300 & 150 mg Wellbutrin XL during the winter months for 8 years. It didn't help me to quit smoking
column3: I did lose a few pounds in the beginning though.  After taking for a week or so I start having trouble sleeping at night. I'm wide awake after 4 hours of sleep but it only lasts for a couple of weeks and then I sleep fine.  They both make me a little scatter brained but especially the 300mg.  It's hard to concentrate.  But as far as the depression goes its great.  The GENERIC did not work AT ALL!  I've had many rounds with my insurance getting them to pay for the name brand but the generic simply did nothing for me.  My doctor had to call them and write on the prescription ""Name brand medically necessary"".  Increase thirst is the only side affect.  It's easy to wean yourself off of these. I don't recommend quitting cold turkey.  Hope this helps someone."

396$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$6/20/2012 12:58:22 AM$Reviewer: intricate_eyes, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $2$1$4$I took 150mg of the generic bupropion HCL XL, once per day in the morning. First thing I noticed on the second day of taking it was that I was unusually short of breath, and my heart started being quickly randomly throughout the day. On the fifth day I woke up with a sore left arm, and the pain spread to the left side of my chest. Developed chest pressure and that continued on for the full 8 days that I took the medication and ended when I went off the medicine. My anxiety also seemed to have increased; I could never calm down and my body always felt heavy. However, the only somewhat positive thing I can mention is that I felt that this medicine kind of woke me up a bit; before I was pretty numb, but I started feeling again. The side effects were enough to make me go off of it within 8 days. I hope to try the name brand Wellbutrin to see if there is an improvement.

55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$This drug is doing a great job for me. I have been on it for 12 years. I originally took 150mg once a day; moved up to twice a day but switched to 300mg slow release so I wouldn't forget to take one of the doses. I tried so many different drugs over the past 20 years that I've lost count and the side affects were often horrific. Once my psychologist recommended Wellbutrin and my psychiatrist concurred I have never switched and it is the only anti-depressant I take. I also dropped 20 lbs of the 30 the other drugs had caused me to gain. It has helped with ADD
column3: SAD and the all encompassing symptoms of depression. There have been a few times during the years when I was unable to take it for several days in a row and you could tell but just one dose and I was back up feeling great. I'm sorry it doesn't work for everyone; it has so few uncomfortable side affects when compared to some of the newer drugs. But for those who have found relief I can tell you that after all these years I still have found relief. (My husband calls them my happy pills!)

416$Condition: Depression$4/21/2012 4:30:52 PM$Reviewer: Olythia, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$Started these about 2 years ago after being  desperate because none of those that act on serotonin had worked for me. Best thing I ever did! I researched it on-line and found the ratio of people praising it to hating it was much more favourable than most other anti-depressants. Problem: I'm in the UK and it is only licensed for giving up smoking. So I have to order it from Europe or USA. I started by taking just a quarter of one 150mg tab and working up to the full dose by day 7. (different for everyone of course)

Doing it this way made it much easier on the side-effects which for me were itchy rash on my hand and foot and difficulty getting to sleep maybe a bit of nausea but I found if I  ate some food with them it helped -even though my research said it shouldn't affect. I have read that taking a quarter of a tablet and building up gradually to lessen side-effects doesn't work. It really does for me. Bupropion has made me feel completely ""normal"" I didn't feel like I was on medication at all
column2: until recently. After about a year and half I found I got occasional head pains. Not a headache as such. If I lay down on my front suddenly to watch television or something like that i would get a sharp pressure-like pain. I would keep still or slowly sit up and it would pass. after a few months I gradually started to get a slight hang-over feeling for a few hours most days. without any changes to my diet etc. I don't normally get headaches. My delivery was very delayed recently and I literally ran out. I was very worried what would happen with suddenly stopping (i could not get any from the doctor of course) Nothing happened so I stayed off them for two months. I can now very slightly feel anxiety on waking up that I used to get but only slightly so I decided to start again rather than wait until it gets bad. Today is the first day and I have a bit of that slight tightness in the head feeling. Anyone else had similar?"

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $1$1$1$"I do not recommend anyone take this medication Wellbutrin.  It caused my thoughts and behavior to be out of control.  I took it because my former MD said
column3: ""if you have chronic pain you also have depression"". I have never been depressed in my life yet placed on Prozac and changed to Wellbutrin. This medication made me end up in a mental health ward where doctors automatically place a person on anti-psych drugs. Anti-psych medications are scary and should never be given to patients automatically.  Wellbutrin made my thoughts and actions so crazy and doctors since have told me that this is a common side affect.  Scary thought! Due to the fact I was discharged on these crazy drugs to take at home I continued to have scary thoughts and odd behavior.  This has been a nightmare that I would not wish on my worse enemy. Ive been in and out of psych wards for four years due to drugs that are on the market and we are told we must take the medicine a doctor orders. The ER doctor sees my medical records of a former  mental illness and then send me back to be committed to a mental ward with several E.R.visits. It was a revolving door as I would be once again on medicine that alters ones thoughts and behavior. I am lucky as my doctor got me off of Wellbutrin and every time I have been forced into a mental health ward by an emergency room doctor
column4: my doctor weans me off of these terrible drugs and I am back to my old self. column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$This medication has been a life saving treatment for me. I am currently on the maximum dose and I also take Lamictal(100mg)and Remeron(30 mg) to help with sleep. column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $3$2$4$"Have been on this med for about 5 years on and off for depression and lack on sexual desire due to Lexapro. column3: speaking to my psychiatrist who specializes in meds and heads the state board where I live
column4: Wellbutrin was actually considered being used as a drug for lacking sexual desire when they did their initial studies. This was due to the results of the initial tests showing increased sexual desire of women and actual orgasm without stimulation. It was being studied at this time to see positive effects for depression. It helped me the first time I took it although I felt like a nympho. Back on it again 3 years ago to help libido but doing nothing but causing constipation...no sexual desire at all. Actually wish I was experiencing my initial use ""urges"" that caused me to stop it
column5: was having ""almost orgasms"" at work and couldn't concentrate."

594$Condition: Depression$3/2/2011 3:43:33 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$5$"I just started taking this drug today
column2: and after reading the reviews I am concerned about the generic version I was given (Bupropion XL
column3: I think). According to one article
column4: it's the patented membrane that allows for extended release that seems to be the problem. Apparently some generics don't use the same XR method
column5: which can lead to a huge release of the active ingredient followed by little to no release. Wellbutrin has a membrane-like wall that allows a constant release
column6: but many generics use pills that just dissolve slowly. Other bodily functions can speed up or slow down the release (i.e.
column7: amount of food in stomach). Just thought this was interesting so I'm passing it along and will also ask my doctor about it.  http://www.prevention.com/health/health/healthy-l iving/find-out-how-to-use-generic-drugs-safely/ar ticle/ca929d93636d6110VgnVCM10000013281eac____

661$Condition: Depression$10/21/2010 8:29:38 PM$Reviewer: medwisegirl, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$Wellbutrin has been great for me. All I wanted to do before taking this was sleep, and when I was up I was grouchy and irritated. I actually like getting up in the morning and enjoy my day. Everyone around me is much happier as well. I tried Cymbalta first and it didn't fit my specific needs, and in fact worsened my depression. There are different medicines for different types of depression. Wellbutrin works on the neurotransmitter dopamine. Dopamine is for motivation and acivating the reward center in the brain. I wouldn't discourage or encourage the use of this drug. It's your doctors job, depending on your depression symptoms, to match you with the best medicine for you. You need not listen to people that say not to try it, everyone is different. This medicine may or may not work for you. Treating depression is not an exact science, due to our lack of knowledge about the brain. Finding the right depression medicine will take trial and error, which can be very frustrating. Stick with it and you will find a medicine that works for you.

742$Condition: Depression$6/15/2010 11:54:53 AM$Reviewer: abirata, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$Wellbutrin had side effects at the beginning - the worst of which were insomnia and constipation. The insomnia abated after about 3 weeks of treatment and I take a fiber supplement to deal with the constipation. It also abates with time but never completely goes away. Another side effect at firt was a general ""hyper"" feeling but that also wore off after a few weeks. Unlike the SSRIs
column2: Wellbutrin does not make me feel ""drugged” - I feel emotions
column3: good and bad - but the difference I notice while taking the drug is that I tend not to brood or obsess over negative events or ideas
column4: it is easier to let them pass. I think it has also made me more able to open up to talking about my situation because I don’t think I have to reign in my “bad” emotions so tightly as I don’t fear them getting out of control. It is easier to work through them
column5: and talk about them. Wellbutrin by itself is a great help
column6: but by far the most effective treatment for me has been talk therapy. Depression runs in the family. I did not start seeking treatment until age 27 when it became overwhelming  and was affecting my work and relationships. The first course of treatment my physician prescribed were SSRIs (Paxil
column7: Prozac and Zoloft)
column8: but I could not tolerate the side effects nausea and drowsiness
column9: but the worst
column10: that although my depression was dampened
column11: so were all my emotions. These side effects never abated. I became even more distant from people I loved and could not function effectively at work because it was difficult to concentrate. I had great doubts about all of the anti-depressants after those experiences
column12: and am skeptical of drug claims and the pharmaceutical industry in general but have to admit that Wellbutrin has been very effective. I know that SSRIs are very effective for many  people - I just wanted to share that portion of my experience because I believed that because they did not work for me
column13: nothing would. I am glad to be proven wrong."

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$4$3$I use to take Wellbutrin many years ago for depression. This was before they came out with the SR and XL. You had to take it using a starter kit that had a certain dosage for each day. Side effects were minimal for me except for severe upset stomach for the initial 2 to 3 weeks. It eventually subsided. My doctor said that side effect is rare. Well NOT 4 me. My doctor wrote me a prescription for XL 300 the other day to help me stop smoking. Im assuming the extended release formula replaces the need for the gradual starter kit. I sure hope so otherwise taking 300mg from the get go may be intolerable for my digestive system. It worked pretty well for my depression but what I remember most was the effect it had on reducing my smoking. Cigs tasted like sucking on molded burnt logs. I quit the medication because at that time I really wanted to enjoy my cigarettes again. Idiot I know. Not this time though. Those old molded burnt logs are going to be thrown out never to return. I suggest this medicine for smoking cessation over that new Cymbalta stuff. It has the same indications at about a tenth of the price. Cimbalta is just ripping people off. I really doubt it affects the brain much differently than does Wellbutrin. Especially when only taken for a short period. Wellbutrin is indicated for smoking cessation. If it was harmful to people who are not depressed I doubt that this purpose would be listed as one of the uses. If I could afford the Cimbalta I'd try it instead just to see how it compares for me versus Wellbutrin in altering the taste of cigarettes. My guess is Cymbalta does not work as well as Wellbutrin for this purpose. It was marketed differently probably due to the stigma some have for taking anti-depressants. It will interesting to see what the effects
column3: if any
column4: while taking when not depressed. It may have the effects of ecstacy...lol doubtful but it would make for quite an experience. Probably would not curb my craving for a cigarette. Will post results later

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$Wellbutrin was a life saver for me. I was diagnosed with Major Depression 5 years ago and initially was prescribed Celexa. I felt a little better but still had no concentration or energy. My psychiatrist added Wellbutrin XL and it turned out to be the answer I needed. I would not have survived my depression without the addition of Wellbutrin to my celexa (300mg Wellbutrin and 40 mg Celexa). I know some people have shared negative side effects of this drug but you will not know unless you try it. It worked well for me but it is not for everyone. If you have depression please do not give up on finding the right medication for you. It just takes some time. I have been on meds and in individual therapy and it has been successful  in treating my depression. I am now to the point where I am titrating my Wellbutrin so that I can be med free and start a family. Thank you Wellbutrin for giving me my life back!

35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$4$5$"Typical story...busy mom of 2 fighting mild depression.  My ""mild"" depression includes a general feeling of lethargy
column3: difficulty motivating myself to do simple things
column4: feeling overwhelmed with the thought of completing simple tasks.  I was functioning in life but at a  lower level.  Anyway onto the med review:  MD prescribed 100 mg 1x a day and then told to work up to 200 mg 1x a day after a week.  First week at 100 mg....tons of headaches
column5: crazy dehydration
column6: wierd flighty feeling
column7: nauseus
column8: lack of appetite.  I convinced myself to stick with it at uped my dose.  Experienced 4 days of the worst headaches of my life.  I had to quit completely b/c I couldn't function.  Waited a week and began 100 mg once a day again and this time no headaches
column9: I am sticking with my low dose since it seems to give me the extra lift I need.  I don't feel medicated or foggy.  The biggest thing to disappear was the feeling of being overwhelmed.  I feel like a weight was lifted off my shoulders.  As for side effects now...I have a tendency to get dehydrated more quickly when on the meds so I have to really drink alot of water.  If I don't hydrate the headaches follow.  Initially my appetite completely disappeared.  Now it's less but not significantly.  This med does seem to reduce cravings in general.  I am not a drinker but had a couple drinks (despite my better judgement) on NY's Eve.  The next day or 2 I felt like the meds weren't working.....felt lethargic
column10: just down.  Definately not worth the drinks of Champagne so I'll abstain 100% for now.  I am at a much lower dosage then is prescribed for most people but it works for me.   Main con i that I do notice that I can become agitated quicker.  I am usually the most laid back person
column11: almost too laid back.  So for me it's not a big deal but I wouldn't recommend this med to anyone who has a tendency to anger easily or experiences anxiety."

column2: 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$4$5$I am not surprised to see other people having headaches with this drug. I took the 2 a day version for 5 months before not being able to stand the headaches anymore.  I also felt very jittery the first week or so.  I recently switched to the extended release medication and my headaches are gone!  My doctor said that maybe the large dose twice a day was like a fire that then burned out over & over.  I would definitely recommend the extended version of this drug.  In the past I had taken zoloft and I did feel great.  A little too great.  I gained 30 lbs over 6 months and had NO libido.  And I couldn't sleep at night to boot!  I did love how I felt
column3: but I had to sleep and I didn't want to take a medication to sleep every night on top of the zoloft.  I like the welbutrin better for me because it only lessened my symptoms enough to be able to wrap my head around the issues in my life that were completely overwhelming me.  It didn't mask the problems as I felt the zoloft did.  Only helped me feel like I could compartmentalize them and start to deal with them.  Definitely make your doctor give you the extended release!

column1: 921$Condition: Depression$10/2/2009 9:33:06 AM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I had suffered from depression for years before I started taking Wellbutrin. Word of caution on the generic version of Wellbutrin 300 XL - I tried it when it was approved and found after a few months that I was becoming depressed again. For me it seemed like instead of medication being steadily administered to my system throughout the day it hit all at once
column2: thus the return of the depression.  I was hoping to be able to save some money with the generic but it is worth it to me to take the brand name.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I am 54 yrs. old with clinical depression and have been on some kind of antidepressant for the last 25 yrs. with less than effective results. In time my appetite came back and have gained the weight back. It also helped with my cravings for habits I had stopped years ago

column2: 55-64 Female  (Patient) $5$5$5$"I have suffered from depression most of my life.  In my early 20’s I started see a psychiatrist.  I received talk therapy as well as antidepressants’ throughout my life.  I have been off & on Prozac for the past 20 years.  For nearly two years

I started to feel like I was going back to my old pattern of sleeping too much (not as bad as before but still too much) and not as much energy as with Wellbutrin..  I am sad to say I did not experience any weight loss with either the Wellbutrin or the generic.  While taking the generic

column1: 1056$Condition: Bipolar Depression$5/2/2009 9:39:22 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I've been on Wellbutrin xl 450mg/day for a little over two years now and for me it is what works. My mood doesn't flip at the slightest negative event and one annoying thing no longer ruins an entire day for me. I can think clearly and positively without losing my ability to be upset when there is a reason to be. (nothing like showing up to a funeral grinning and cracking jokes because you can't feel sad.) I don't have issues with getting up in the morning (well not ones that I didn't have long before the bipolar set in. I am not a morning person.) and I don't have the issues of manic episodes where I can't sleep until I have to be medicated into unconsciousness. I no longer constantly sit at my desk with the lights off holding a box cutter and staring at it for hours or go off on screaming rants about things that are trivial. I feel in control of myself and my actions as opposed to the constant feeling of being out of control; an observer in my own self destruction. This is what it does for me. Considering that we are all complex creatures of finely balanced chemicals it may not for you but that doesn't mean there isn't something that can help you regain control of your life. Take time with your physician to figure out what is right for you. And be picky it's your life if something isn't working go back to your doctor and try something else don't torture yourself and end up even worse.

35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$4$5$I have been on Wellbutrin for about 10 months.  In December I began taking the 300mg XL version.  It helped me tremendously.  I had so much energy and motivation to do things.  It was a generic.  In March I had to switch my pharmacy so they gave me a different generic.  It was made by Watson.  I started getting really tired all the time.  I was constantly angry with people for no good reason and also seemed to be obbsessive compulsive.  There were also many physical side effects also.  I finally realized it was the medicine and stopped it immediately.  I began feeling so much better within 24 hours.  I can't believe the difference in these generics.  Please pay close attention to how you begin feeling when you take these.  I seriously think I would have become suicidal if I had not quit and I have never felt that way before.  If it's not working for you go to your doctor and try something else because these medicines can really change your entire personality.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$"I am taking Wellbutrin SR. This stuff is so good they should put it in the water supply! I have energy
column3: my spastic boss does not get me annoyed anymore. I am calm

column2: Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been on wellbutrin for 15 years-I came off of it for a short time but the anxiety caused me to return to it again. Like most depression sufferers I have tried many drugs over the years but this one has the least side effects and works great. I occasionally get dry mouth so you do need to stay hydrated.  I was a smoker and a drinker and have kicked both habits as the drug really does reduce cravings for any pleasure. Unfortunately that does include sex as well-it does decrease your libido but that can be overcome if you work at it! It does not decrease the pleasure level but the desire to get started just isn't there. I did have a period of time where I was not eating as it does also take away your cravings for food. My hubby loves to eat so he makes me eat too
column3: so I have not had anorexia since I met him but I did with my first husband. So I would say that an understanding mate goes a long way toward helping to make this drug a success. I take 150 sr upon waking and before bed. My insurer is also pushing the generic but that did not work for me. I understand there are some generics that are better than others and if the cost is a factor you could try those first. I am convinced that wellbutin treats alcoholism because it runs in my family and I was a problem drinker until I took wellbutrin. I can have a drink now and not want another-but that may just be me. It is sure worth a try if you drink too much-I don't know why it is not more widely used for treating alcoholism because it works. You do have to take wellbutrin for 60 to 90 days to get the full effect of the drug.During that time you do have dry mouth but that subsides after a while and was not a significant problem for me. I am 62 years old so I don't know how much longer I will take it but the doctors seem to think that it is a lifelong drug. It has made a drastic change in my life and I recomend it highly!!

1141$Condition: Depression$2/24/2009 8:24:38 PM$Reviewer: ABMN, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$4$5$In Dec 2007 I was prescribed Wellbutrin 150mg, after the initial few weeks it just didn't seem to be working. My doctor bumped me up the the XL. It started working almost immediately. It felt as if the veil and earmuffs had been removed and colors and sounds became real again. I was extremely happy with the 50 lbs I lost. Sex drive came back with a vengeance. No listed side effects. It is now Feb 2009 and it doesn't seem to be working anymore; back to being irritable, short tempered and just sad. Going to Dr in 2 days to see if something else will work. One side effect that I can't find anyone else having is it messed with my period, even on birth control. My period would come whenever it wanted regardless of what week of pills I was on. Once I switched to taking the BCP at night and Wellbutrin XL in the a.m. it seemed to get MUCH better. Now that the wellbutrin isn't working as great, my cycle is completely whacked. Usually one week w/o it, then get it for a few days, then another week w/o, etc. Doctors say it has nothing to do with each other but I have been on the same BCP for almost 6 years and it didn't happen until I started taking the Wellbutrin XL.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$3$"     -Generic Brand vs. Name Brand Wellbutrin XL-

column1: I've been on Wellbutrin for (about) a year and MUST comment on the effects of the generic brand
column2: Bupropion (Sp?).
I spent a while on the generic version and failed to progress out of my depressive state. For a few weeks I felt like I was mildly feeling a change
column3: but eventually it felt like I had plateaued
column4: and shortly after
column5: I returned to spiraling downward.

column1: There were other medications added and subtracted to Wellbutrin in order to determine the right combination of drugs to aid my depression/anxiety/ADD. I AM POSITIVE that my only improvement was the result of other medications (Lamictal- mood stabilizer).
It has been documented that the generic version of this drug does NOT produce the same progressive results as the name brand. I can confidently say
column2: that my experience w/ Bupropion was not a good one
column3: in fact
column4: I'd say it was horrible
column5: and at times
column6: worse than my initial state.

column1: I have been back to taking the name brand Wellbutrin XL for about 3-4 months. I have continued to feel a drastic improvement in my mental state
column2: and finally recognize the person that I knew I always was. It has enabled me to live my life again.

column1: Although I have felt such a great improvement
column2: the cost is $167 (that's with insurance)
column3: which is the CO-PAY! Without the insurance
column4: the cost is $230-$270
column5: and very few insurance companies offer reasonable coverage for Wellbutrin XL
column6: since the generic version was approved."

After a month on the generic I was going on shopping sprees and spending money I didn't have and had an anxiety attacks for the first time in years.
